de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.persistence
Interface Handler

All Known Implementing Classes:
ContinentHandler, ContinentHandler, CountryHandler, CountryHandler, NeighbourHandler, NeighbourHandler, PlayerHandler, PlayerHandler, WorldHandler, WorldHandler
public interface Handler

Each persistence handler needs the basic "CRUD" operations. CRUD is: "In computer programming, Create, Read, Update and Delete (CRUD) are the four basic functions of persistent storage. Sometimes CRUD is expanded with the words retrieve instead of read or destroy instead of delete. It is also sometimes used to describe user interface conventions that facilitate viewing, searching, and changing information; often using computer-based forms and reports." from: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Create,_read,_update_and_delete

Since:
1.0
Version:
$Id: Handler.java 663 2010-07-04 16:24:05Z andre.koenig $

readAll

java.util.Vector<? extends ValueObject> readAll(ValueObject reference)
                                                throws PersistenceException
Reads all by an given reference value object. Note: The reference parameter is optional. We use it if we have to read data by a given referenced value object (for example: read all countries by the referenced world). This is because Java does not support optional parameters. In some cases, like this one, this restriction is not very dressy.

Parameters:
reference - The referenced value object.
Returns:
A vector with value objects.
Throws:
PersistenceException - Common persistence exception
